definition: to have the power to rally supporters
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)

sentences.english: To expand its appeal, Samsung is opening an app store.
sentences.chinese: 爲了擴大其號召力，三星的應用商店正在開張。
毫無疑問，菲利普斯是個頗有號召力的演說家。

sentences.english: De La Hoya has long been boxing's most popular fighter and biggest attraction.
sentences.chinese: 霍亞一直是最有號召力和最炙手可熱的拳手。

sentences.english: Pleasant appearance, mature and charismatic personality, good professional spirit and team spirit.
sentences.chinese: 品貌端正，成熟穩重，具號召力，有良好的團隊精神。

sentences.english: More so than a lot of games, Scrabble seems to have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 拼字遊戲比其它許多遊戲更顯出其廣泛的號召力。

definition: unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
